intro: Cynometra glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's ironwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its hard, dense wood and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry forest or woodland habitats. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
